text: Note I am using Pluto. So that might be a little difference between the Pluto output and the command line output?

elements.text: Note I am using Pluto. So that might be a little difference between the Pluto output and the command line output?

text: Yeah, in my experience Pluto not always shows the same output as the REPL would do. Or Jupyter. Not sure why this is the case.

elements.text: Yeah, in my experience Pluto not always shows the same output as the REPL would do. Or Jupyter. Not sure why this is the case.

text: Hey <@UC0SY9JFP> Yeah, this is a known issue <https://github.com/fonsp/Pluto.jl/issues/868>. I am not sure if you have seen this issue, but hopefully they will figure it out. Something to do with how pluto processes the output from Turing.

elements.text: Yeah, this is a known issue
. I am not sure if you have seen this issue, but hopefully they will figure it out. Something to do with how pluto processes the output from Turing.

text: But I was able to just compute the chains but suppress the output using `;`. And then I could use some other Turing functions to pull out what I needed. It is a workaround for now.
